# # Migration Strategy  
 Migrating an existing IoT fleet to 128 - bit UIDs must be carefully phased to ensure continuity .
to ensure continuity
In the registry or device firmware , the new 128 - bit ID should become the primary identifier
In the registry or device firmware , the new 128 - bit ID should become the primary identifier ; the old ID can be stored as a legacy field for a transition period .
Devices incapable of updating immediately should be confined to isolated subnets or given temporary proxy IDs .
given temporary proxy IDs
that can not be changed immediately
For devices that can not be changed immediately , the cloud service could translate their existing IDs to dummy UUIDs internally .

# # Testing & Validation  
 A rigorous testing plan ensures the new UID system is reliable and secure before full deployment .
Only after pilot success should rollout proceed fleet - wide .
Each test phase should have defined success criteria
( e.g. “ no unhandled collisions detected ”
Each test phase should have defined success criteria ( e.g. “ no unhandled collisions detected ” , “ device authentication passes 100 % of time ” , “ latency within X ms ” ) .
Successful testing will demonstrate that the new UID scheme works reliably and that the transition preserves functionality .
